ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course to all political science and global affairs students. Understanding the subject of the course is essential to students entering public service.

I will certainly, and have already, recommend "Violence" to fellow students. I believe it is representative of Yale's strengths in the field of political science - and hope to be able to take further classes with Kocher and colleagues in the future.
I would recommend it. It is a useful introduction to the literature concerned with civil war.
Yes. This course did a great job introducing the student to the important literature on violence and the shortcomings of this literature.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As a MA student, I discovered both theoretical approaches and subject matter that I think will contribute directly to my MA thesis.
